intro: Lychnocephalus bicolor, commonly known as the two-colored borage, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue and white bi-color flowers. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. Its leaves are hairy and often have a bluish tinge, while the stems are slender and branching. Lychnocephalus bicolor is known for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its attractive appearance.
